summary: phytochemical investigations have isolated and identified >70 compounds, including anthraquinones, naphthopyrones, volatile oils and sterols (7,8). chrysophanol and aurantio-obtusin are the indicators components. leaflets are formed of 3 leaf pairs and are glaucous, membranous, glabrous or pubescent. the base is somewhat oblique, usually rounded and there are 8–10 pairs of main nerves. obtusifolia blossoms from July to September and produces fruit from September to October. C. obtusifolia is cultivated in multiple provinces of china. it is distributed in moist and sunny places, in hillside shrubs and in the sandy soil of river banks. a number of methods have been developed to identify and distinguish these. all compounds isolated from Cassiae semen are listed in Table I. their chemical structures are displayed in Figs. 1–3. iobioside (41) 29 Emodin-1-O--gentiobioside (41) 30 Obtusifolin-2-O--D-glucoside (42) 31 Chysophanol-1-O--D-glucoside (41) 32 Alaternin-1-O--D-glucopyranoside (29) 34 Aurantio-obtusin-6-O--D-glucopyranoside (43) 37 Emodin-8-O- osyl-(13)-O--glucopyranosyl-(16)-O--D-glucopyranosyl-(13)-O--D-glucopyranosyl-(16)-O--D-glucopyranosyl)oxy]-8-hydroxy-3-methyl-9,10-anthraquinone (42) 46 4,6,7-trimethoxyl-aloe-emodin-8- glucopyranoside (54) 68 l-hydroxyl-2-acetyl-3,8-dimethoxy-6-O-[-D-apiofuranosyl-(l2)--D-glucopyranosyl]-naphthalene (55) Other compounds 69 Malvalic acid (5,57) 70 Sterculic acid (5) 71 Mandelic acid (5) 72 Campesterol (5) 73 Aspidinol (58) 74 5, dihydroxy-6-methoxy-7-methyl anthraquinone, 1-hydroxy-3,7-diformyl anthraquinone, chrysarobin, 8-O-methylchrysophanol, 1-O-methylemodin, 1,2-dimethoxy-8-hydroxy-3-methyl-9,10-anthraquinone and l,7-trimethoxyl-6,8-dihydroxy-3-methylanthr cassiaside B and cassiaside C were identified in the seeds of C. obtusifolia (52). other naphthopyrones, including torosachrysone, isotoralactone, cassialactone, cassiaside B2, cassiaside C2, nor-rubrofusarin-6-O--D (6′-O-acetyl) glucopyranoside and l-hydroxyl-2 anthraquinones Cassiae semen contains structurally diverse and biologically active anthraquinones. 53 anthraquinones have been isolated and identified. torachrysone, rubrofusarin and rubrofusarin-6-O--D-gentiobioside were isolated from C. tora seeds. cassiaside B and cassiaside C were identified in the seeds of C. obtusifolia or C. tora. dimethoxy-6-O-[-D-apiofuranosyl- (l2)--D-glucopyranosyl]-naphthalene were also isolated from C. obtusifolia seeds. n-hexadecanoic acid (12.53%), 9,10-anthracenedione, 1,8-dihydroxy-3-methyl (7.66%), octadecanoic acid (4.56%) and 13 aquinones include emodin, chrysophanol, physcion, aloe-emodin, rhein, obtusin, chryso-obtusin, aurantio-obtusin, questin, 1-desmethylaurantio-obtusin, 1-desmethylobtusin, 1-desmethylchryso-obtusin, chrysophan toralactone, rubrofusarin triglucoside, cassiaside, nor-rubrofusarin gentiobioside, cassiaside B, cassiaside C, torachrysone apiglucoside, torachrysone gentiobioside, cassiatoroside, demethylflavasperone gentiobioside and cassialactone gentiobioside were isolated from C. o the major volatile components were 9-octadecenoic acid (E) (22.15%), n-hexadecanoic acid (12.53%), 9,10-anthracenedione, 1,8-dihydroxy-3-methyl (7.66%), octadecanoic acid (4.56%) and 13-octadecenoic acid methyl ester (Z) (3.84%). ethanol and aqueous extracts of Cassiae emen significantly decreased serum levels of total cholesterol (TC), triglyceride (TG) and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) soluble fibers from C. tora seeds markedly decreased liver TC and TG levels in rats fed with a high-cholesterol diet. chrysophanol, physcion, aurantio-obtusin, obtusifolin and emodin have been observed to decrease the levels of TC and TG. previous studies have demonstrated that anthraquinones isolated from Cassiae semen were effective substances during hypolipidemic activities. rubrofusarin-6-O--d-gentiobioside (compound 49) and cassiaside (compound 52) significantly inhibited the expression of transforming growth factor (TGF)-1 and extracellular matrix protein in glomerular mesangial cells cultured under diabetic conditions. methanol extract of Cassia semen showed protective activity against STZ-induced renal fibrosis in diabetic rats. treatment with C. obtusifolia (0.1–10 g/ml) significantly attenuated secondary calcium dysregulation and cell death induced by N-methyl-D-aspartate and 3-nitropropionic acid. no significant effect on cell death was induced by incubation with naturally-secreted oligomers of amyloid (A) DA cells protected against 6-OHDA- and N-methyl-4-phenylpyridinium iodide-induced toxicities. obtusifolia (50 mg/kg/day for 15 days) significantly protected DA neuronal degeneration in a mouse Parkinson's disease model. ra seeds were the primary chemical constituents (42,50) the preventative effects of Cassiae semen on acute liver injury in mice induced by CCl4 have also been investigated. rhein (compound 5) and torachrysone (compound 5) from the seeds of C. tora exhibited antibacterial activity against Escherichia coli K12. emodin (compound 1) from C. tora seeds has a median lethal dose (LC50) value of 0.102, 0.163, 0.385 and 0.046 g/l against Rhizoctonia solani, Botrytis cinerea, Phytophthora infestans and Erysiphe graminis. it has been reported that ethanol and aqueous extracts of C. obtusifolia seeds were inhibitory the water extract of Cassiae semen showed a potent ability to scavenge free oxygen radicals. the inhibitory effects of WSP on serum levels of MDA were used to evaluate its antioxidation capabilities. the results showed that WSP decreased MDA serum levels with an IC50 value of 15.80% (96) chryso-obtusin (compound 7) and aurantio-obtusin (compound 8) showed weaker antioxidant activity (IC50 >200 g/ml) hypotensive activity Aqueous and ethanol extracts of Cassiae semen have been reported to possess hypotensive effects (101) hypotensive activity Aqueous and ethanol extracts of Cassiae semen consistently reduced arterial blood pressure in anesthetized rats. ethanol extract of Cassiae semen significantly decreased blood pressure in hypertensive rats by inhibiting receptor-controlled calcium channels on vessels and regulating the secretion of nitric oxide and inducible nitric oxide synthase. other pharmacological effects include estrogenic, anti-allergic, antigenotoxic, antimutagenic and cardioprotective effects. anthraquinone aglycones and naphthopyrone glycosides exhibited significant antimutagenic activity in vitro. the mechanism associated with these compounds may be mediated via interactions with a microsomal activating system (14) n-butanol and ethyl acetate extracts were the most effective (62,63) soluble fibers from C. obtusifolia seeds significantly decreased liver TC and TG levels in rats fed with a high-cholesterol diet. l, physcion, aurantio-obtusin, obtusifolin and emodin have been observed to decrease the levels of TC and TG. previous studies have demonstrated that anthraquinones isolated from Cassiae semen were effective substances during hypolipidemic activities. methanol extract of Cassia semen inhibited the expression of transforming growth factor (TGF)-1 and extracellular matrix protein in glomerular mesangial cells cultured under diabetic conditions. the results indicated that oral treatment with the methanol extract inhibited the development of diabetic nephropathy in streptozotocin-induced diabetic rats. treatment with C. obtusifolia (0.1–10 g/ml) significantly attenuated secondary calcium dysregulation and cell death induced by N-methyl-D-aspartate and 3-nitropropionic acid. no significant effect on cell death was induced by incubation with naturally-secreted oligomers of amyloid (A) aqueous extract of C. tora L. seeds has been used for the protection of the liver. a weak anti-hepatotoxic activity in CCl4-induced mice was observed when the drug was administered orally at a dose of 670 mg/kg. ethanol extract of Cassiae semen increased serum levels of SOD. total anthraquinones from Cassiae semen exhibited a protective effect on alcohol-induced acute liver injury in mice. physcion (compound 3) has an LC50 value of 0.248, 0.263, 0.518, and 0.073 g/l against R. solani, B. cinerea, P. infestans and E. graminis. it has been reported that ethanol and aqueous extracts of C. obtusifolia seeds were inhibitory against Helicobacter pylori strains. Xv and Hu (94) demonstrated that the water extract of Cassiae semen exhibited a potent ability to scavenge free oxygen radicals. the results showed that WSP decreased MDA serum levels with an IC50 value of 15.80% (96) chryso-obtusin (compound 7) and aurantio-obtusin (compound 8) showed weaker antioxidant activity (IC50 >200 g/ml) hypotensive activity Aqueous and ethanol extracts of Cassiae semen have been reported to possess hypotensive effects (101) hypotensive activity Aqueous and ethanol extracts of Cassiae semen exhibited hypotensive activity. the media portion of the medullary reticular formation is directly involved in the hypotensive effect of C. tora seeds 103. the ethanol extract of Cassiae semen significantly decreased blood pressure in hypertensive rats by inhibiting receptor-controlled calcium channels on vessels. other activities include estrogenic, anti-allergic, antigenotoxic, antimutagenic and cardioprotective effects. anthraquinone aglycones (compounds 2, 7 and 8) and naphthopyrone glycosides (compounds 49 and 52) showed significant antimutagenic activity in vitro. the mechanism associated with these compounds may be mediated via interactions with a microsomal activating system (14). the ethanol and aqueous extracts of Cassiae emen significantly decreased the serum levels of total cholesterol (TC), triglyceride (TG) and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) however, they increased the levels of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) previous studies have demonstrated that anthraquinones isolated from Cassiae semen were effective ic conditions suggest that the active compounds in Cassia semen may be effective in the treatment of diabetes. methanol extract inhibited the development of diabetic nephropathy in rats. the results dysregulation and cell death induced by N-methyl-D-aspartate and 3-nitropropionic acid. no significant effect on cell death was induced by incubation with naturally-secreted oligomers of amyloid (A) exhibited significantly protective effects in primary cultured hepatocytes against CCl4. ethanol extract of Cassiae semen has been observed to increase serum levels of SOD. total anthraquinones from and 0.073 g/l against R. solani, B. cinerea, P. infestans and E. graminis. it has been reported that ethanol and aqueous extracts of C. obtusifolia seeds were inhibitory against Helicobacter p ethyl acetate fraction and n-butanol fraction of Cassiae semen were evaluated by DPPH radical scavenging activity. ethyl acetate fraction had a lower IC50 value of 56.4 g/ml, compared with 80.6 g/ml for n-butanol fraction. chryso-obtusin (compound 7) and aurantio-obtusin (compound 8) showed weaker antioxidant activity (IC50 >200 g/ml) the methanolic extract of C. tora seeds exerted a greater antioxidant activity than the other organic solvents. the ethanol extract of Cassiae semen significantly decreased blood pressure in hypertensive rats by inhibiting receptor-controlled calcium channels on vessels and regulating the secretion of nitric oxide and inducible nitric oxide synthase. other pharmacological effects include estrogenic, anti-allergic, antigenotoxic, antimutagenic and via interactions with a microsomal activating system (14) obtusin, emodin and rhein in Cassiae semen with satisfactory results (112) chrysophanol and aurantio-obtusin are used as the indicator compounds to characterize the quality of Cassiae semen. 79 compounds including anthraquinones, naphthopyrones and volatile oil have been isolated and identified from Cassiae semen. it is anticipated that the comprehensive and current research on the pharmacological activities of extracts, as well as on active molecules isolated from Cassiae semen will inspire novel strategies in therapeutics for curing a number of different ailments. anti-diabetic activity Inhibits AGEs activity Cassiaside, cassiaside C, rubrofusarin-6-O--D-gentiobioside, cassiaside In vitro (16) Inhibits AGEs accumulation and, RAGE and COX-2 expression Methanol extract In vitro/vivo (75,76) Downregulates the expression of TGF-1, CTGF and smad3 and upregulates the protein expression antibacterial activity Anti-Staphylococcus aureus, anti-Escherichia coli K12 Naphthalenes, anthraquinones In vitro (17) Exhibits fungicidal activity against Botrytis cinerea, Erysiphe graminis, Phytophthora infestans,
